title: 111_hr233
content: The "Railroad Antitrust Enforcement Act of 2009" is the short title of this Act. It applies the antitrust laws to rail carriers. The Railroad Antitrust Enforcement Act of 2009 amends various sections of the Clayton Act and the Federal Trade Commission Act to exclude rail carriers from certain provisions. The Railroad Antitrust Enforcement Act of 2009 amends laws to exclude rail carriers from certain provisions related to unfair competition. The Railroad Antitrust Enforcement Act of 2009 amends laws to exclude rail carriers from certain provisions related to unfair competition, including the termination of antitrust exemptions in Title 49. The Railroad Antitrust Enforcement Act of 2009 amends Section 10706 of title 49, United States Code, to remove antitrust laws and exemptions for rail carriers. The Railroad Antitrust Enforcement Act of 2009 amends Section 10706 of title 49, United States Code, removing antitrust laws and exemptions for rail carriers. This includes provisions regarding agreements approved under subsection (a) and the impact on shippers, consumers, and affected communities. The Board must consider these impacts when reviewing such agreements. The Railroad Antitrust Enforcement Act of 2009 amends Section 11321 of title 49, United States Code, regarding agreements approved by the Board and their impact on shippers, consumers, and affected communities. The Board must make findings on the impact, include them in the administrative record, submit them to other reviewing agencies, and make them available for judicial review. The Railroad Antitrust Enforcement Act of 2009 amends Section 11321 of title 49, United States Code, by adding provisions regarding the application of antitrust laws to transactions, including those related to the pooling of railroad cars. The Board must consider the impact on shippers and affected communities when reviewing such transactions. Conforming amendments are made to the heading of section 10706. The Railroad Antitrust Enforcement Act of 2009 amends Section 11321 of title 49, United States Code, by adding provisions regarding the application of antitrust laws to transactions, including those related to the pooling of railroad cars. Conforming amendments are made to the heading of section 10706. SEC. 4. CLARIFICATIONS REGARDING APPLICABILITY OF REGULATORY DOCTRINES. The antitrust laws apply to rail carriers without regard to filed rates or complaints challenging rates. In civil actions against rail carriers, district courts can defer to the Surface Transportation Board's jurisdiction. The term "antitrust laws" includes the Clayton Act and section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act for unfair competition. SEC. 5. EFFECTIVE DATE. The Act and its amendments will take effect upon enactment, with limitations on filing civil actions under antitrust laws for conduct concluded before a specified period. No civil action can be filed to dissolve mergers or acquisitions completed before the Act's enactment.
